question.text: Three particles <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>P</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mi>Q</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>R</mi></math> are moving along the vectors <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>,</mo><mo>  </mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>, respectively. They strike on a point and start to move in different directions. Now particle <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>P</mi></math> is moving normal to the plane which contains vector <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>.</mo></math> Similarly particle <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>Q</mi></math> is moving normal to the plane which contains vector <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi>C</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>.</mo></math> The angle between the direction of motion of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>P</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>Q</mi></math> is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msqrt><mi>x</mi></msqrt></mfrac></mfenced><mo>.</mo></math> Then the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><menclose notation="bottom"><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo></menclose></math> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>.</mo></math>

solution.text:
Direction of P, v^1=±A→×B→|A→×B→|=±i^-j^+k^3

Direction of Q, v^2=±A→×C→|A→×C→|=±2k^2=±k^

Angle between v^1 and v^2,

v^1·v^2v^1v^2=±13(1)(1)=±13

⇒x=3
